sentence.Network_en: The Appalachians run through thirteen states.
sentence.Network_cn: 阿巴拉契亚山脉穿经十三个州.

sentence.Network_en: He built himself a cabin in a hollow high up in the Appalachians.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在阿巴拉契亚山上的一个山洞中建造了一座小屋.

sentence.Network_en: The scent of pine and the sound of crickets floated down from the foothill Appalachians.
sentence.Network_cn: 松树的香味和蟋蟀的鸣叫声从阿巴拉契亚山麓飘送过来.

means.word_mean: 1. a mountain range in the eastern United States extending from Quebec to the Gulf of Mexico; a historic barrier to early westward expansion of the United States
